passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Stem cell research has the potential to revolutionize medicine. • Embryonic stem cells can differentiate into any cell type in the body. • Adult stem cells, found in various tissues, can only differentiate into specific cell types. • Induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) are adult cells reprogrammed to an embryonic-like state.
question: Which choice most effectively explains the versatility of embryonic stem cells in comparison to adult stem cells?

choices.A: Stem cell research has the potential to revolutionize medicine with the use of embryonic stem cells.
choices.B: Embryonic stem cells can differentiate into any cell type, while adult stem cells are limited to specific cell types.
choices.C: Induced pluripotent stem cells are adult cells that can differentiate into any cell type like embryonic stem cells.
choices.D: Adult stem cells are found in various tissues and can differentiate into a limited range of cell types.

explanation: B: 'Embryonic stem cells can differentiate into any cell type, while adult stem cells are limited to specific cell types.' is the correct answer because it effectively compares the versatility of embryonic stem cells with the limitations of adult stem cells.
distractor_explanation: 'Stem cell research has the potential to revolutionize medicine with the use of embryonic stem cells.' is incorrect because it does not compare embryonic stem cells to adult stem cells.

'Induced pluripotent stem cells are adult cells that can differentiate into any cell type like embryonic stem cells.' is incorrect because it focuses on iPSCs and does not compare embryonic stem cells to adult stem cells.

'Adult stem cells are found in various tissues and can differentiate into a limited range of cell types.' is incorrect because it only discusses adult stem cells and does not make a comparison to embryonic stem cells.
